Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Get out of the car.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Why did you want to go to breakfast if you're not hungry?

Speaker: dan
Dialogue: I just wanted to come here.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: To Denny's? I wasn't going to say anything, but why Denny's?

Speaker: dan
Dialogue: This Denny's.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Okay. Why this Denny's?

Speaker: dan
Dialogue: It's kind of embarrassing but,

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Go ahead.

Speaker: dan
Dialogue: I had a dream about this place.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Oh boy.

Speaker: dan
Dialogue: You see what I mean...

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Okay, so you had a dream about this place. Tell me.

Speaker: dan
Dialogue: Well ... it's the second one I've had, but they were both the same......they start out that I'm in here but it's not day or night. It's kinda half night, but it looks just like this except for the light, but I'm scared like I can't tell ya. Of all people you're standing right over there by that counter. You're in both dreams and you're scared. I get even more frightened when I see how afraid you are and then I realize what it is - there's a man...in back of this place. He's the one ... he's the one that's doing it. I can see him through the wall. I can see his face and I hope I never see that face ever outside a dream.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: So, you came to see if he's out there?

Speaker: dan
Dialogue: To get rid of this god-awful feeling.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Right then.

Speaker: dan
Dialogue: Around here.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Dan! ... Dan! You all right? ... Dan!

Speaker: old lady
Dialogue: It's time to say goodbye, Betty. It's been so nice travelling with you.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Thank you, Irene. I was so excited and nervous. It was sure great to have you to talk to.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Now, remember I'll be watching for you on the big screen.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Okay Irene. Won't that be the day.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: The best of luck to you, Betty. Take care of yourself and be careful.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Okay I will. Thanks again.

Speaker: cab driver
Dialogue: Where to?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: 1612 Havenhurst.

Speaker: cab driver
Dialogue: Got it!

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Hi there...ten bucks says you're Betty.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I am, Mrs. Lanois. It is Mrs. Lanois isn't it?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Pleased to meet you.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Okay, Coco.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: I guess it was your grandfather, was it ... he called me to check in, said you were on your way and for you to call when you get in. Nice man... farmer I hear.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Yes, he is. He raises corn.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Damn lot of corn raised in Hollywood these days too.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Well, I ...

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: You don't have to tell me. It's written all over that pretty face of yours.. You came here to be an actress. I just hope you'll remember there's never been a great poem called "tits and ass."

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: You probably don't remember her, but Louise Bonner lives right over there in number 29. When she isn't drunk she runs a damn good acting class.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Have many famous actors and actresses lived here? I was meaning to ask you that.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Honey, all the great ones came through here at one time or another.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I guess I've come to quite a place.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Sweetheart, you don't know the half of it.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: No, I don't.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: That's good. They're allowed, but I don't like 'em...for obvious reasons. One man used to live here that had a prize fighting kangaroo. You wouldn't believe what that kangaroo did to this courtyard ... let's see your Aunt's apartment ... it's a good one.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I can hardly wait, Coco.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: It's unbelievable!

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: I told ya.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Wow!

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Now I guess you and your Aunt have an understanding. So here's the key and you need anything, just give a holler.  Everybody in this building's pretty much okay with me or they wouldn't be here. If you want, later I'll introduce you around. No hard feelings if you don't, and don't forget the rooftop garden. It's just up the stairs we passed. It's open to all the tenants. You can see the Hollywood sign from there.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Oh Coco thank you. Thank you so much.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: You got it! See you later honey.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Oh my!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I'm Ruth's niece. My name's Betty. I'm sure she told you I was coming.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I understand. I saw the dress. I...I'm sorry.   Are you all right?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Oh my god. I'm sorry. I'll let you get back to that. I'm going to get unpacked.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Hi...do you work with my Aunt?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I...I mean......I...it's none of my business.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: She has pretty red hair... she is very kind I think.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: She sure is. She's letting me stay here while she's working on a movie that's being made in Canada, but I guess you know that.  I couldn't afford a place like this in a million years. Unless of course I'm discovered and become a movie star. Of course, I'd rather be known as a great actress than a movie star, but sometimes people end up being both and that is, I guess you'd say, sort of why I came here. I'm sorry, I'm just so excited to be here..I mean I just came here from Iowa and now I'm in this dream place. You can imagine how I feel.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: I think I've been hurt.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Oh...

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: But, this could be serious.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: No...I need to sleep.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: If you have a concussion you shouldn't sleep.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: It will be okay if I sleep. I need to lie down and sleep.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: All right, but...I'm going to check on you.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: So man, that's unheard of ... an accident like that ... who coulda foreseen that.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Unreal ... so, you're looking good. Whatcha doin' these days?

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Well, not much Ed. Just doin' some stuff for this guy.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Making ends meet, huh.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Hardly.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Yeah, look at my digs ... times are tough.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Oh, things aren't so bad. Gee, I hope you're not goin' to get in any trouble.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: It was just a thing. The story made you laugh.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Yeah, that's a funny story.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Yeah, the history of the world in phone numbers.

Speaker: voices
Dialogue: What the hell .... what happened? What's this cord doing here? It's the vacuum. It's the vacuum what did it.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: So what's the problem?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: There is no problem.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: So why did you idiots bring me here? ... I'm in the middle of making a picture.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: He isn't gonna like it.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Hello ... who're we talkin' about here?

Speaker: robert smith
Dialogue: You see Adam... there are some suggestions which are to be brought forward ... and I know you said you would entertain suggestions and that's all anybody here is asking you to do.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: What're you talking about?

Speaker: robert smith
Dialogue: An open mind ... You're in the process of re-casting your lead actress and I'm...  We're asking you to keep an open mind.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Ah... the Castigliane brothers. Let me introduce you around ... please ... sit down.  ... this is Mr. Darby whom you know and this is the director Adam Kesher and his manager Robert Smith

Speaker: luigi castigliane
Dialogue: Espresso.

Speaker: vincenzo castigliane
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Uh  what's the photo for?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: What's the photo for?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: A recommendation... a recommendation to you Adam.

Speaker: vincenzo castigliane
Dialogue: Not a recommendation.

Speaker: luigi castigliane
Dialogue: This is the girl.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: What girl? For what? What is this Ray?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: We'd be happy to put her in the pile for considerations ... you'd be pleased to know there's quite a lot of interest in this role.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Interest?! There's six of the top actresses that want this thing.

Speaker: luigi castigliane
Dialogue: This is the girl.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Ray...you better take care of this.

Speaker: robert smith
Dialogue: Hold on ... hold on, Adam.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Hold on!!!!!!!! There's no way, there's no way!!!

Speaker: luigi castigliane
Dialogue: Napkin.

Speaker: espresso man
Dialogue: Pardon?

Speaker: luigi castigliane
Dialogue: Napkin.

Speaker: espresso man
Dialogue: Of course. Excuse me.

Speaker: luigi castigliane
Dialogue: Is shit!

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I'm sorry. That was a highly recommended...

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Wait a minute!! What's going on here?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: There's no way that girl is in my movie!

Speaker: luigi castigliane
Dialogue: That is the girl.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Hey!!!!! That girl is not in my film!!!

Speaker: vincenzo castigliane
Dialogue: It is no longer your film.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: You'd better fix this, Ray!!!

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I'll speak to someone.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: And by the way, Ray, I don't know who these guys are kidding, but every foot of film I've shot is in a vault at the lab that only I can access. No one's getting that film!!

Speaker: robert smith
Dialogue: This is a catastrophe...  you told me they might insist on a girl, that's all.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me, Robert? That's what I mean ... you set me up! I woulda never come here.  I'm leaving. I'm a director you don't want to lose ... you guys better fix this!!

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Well...I didn't know that was going to happen.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Did the Castigliane brothers get out of that limo?

Speaker: attendant
Dialogue: They two guys in dark suits?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Castigliane brothers?

Speaker: limo driver
Dialogue: Beat it!

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: O.K.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: No Grandpa, you wouldn't believe it. It's more beautiful than I ever dreamed ... no she left me a lot of food. The refrigerator's full ... Aunt Ruthie said she'd call me when she got settled... it was real smooth. I sat next to a lady who gave up her first class seat to a boy with a broken leg. She was so nice to me. She invited me to her house sometime. It's in Bel Air which is a place where people have a lot of money... I will. Everybody's telling me to be careful, but I sure love it here Grandpa. Thank you for helping me get here ... yeah, it's long distance. I love you. Say hello to Grams. Give her a big kiss for me. Okay, I love you Grandpa ... bye.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: I'm... sorry. I ...  Betty's heart softens.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: What is it Rita?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: I'm...I'm... oh no... I thought when I woke up... I thought sleep would do it ...

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: I don't know who I am.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: What do you mean? You're Rita.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: I'm not. I don't know what my name is. I don't know who I am!!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: This is your purse. Your name must be in your purse.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: I ... yes, but ... I ...

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Open it!

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: Who is it please?

Speaker: receptionist
Dialogue: You may go right in, Ray.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Good afternoon Mr. Roque. .

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I know they said...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Then... I guess it's so .... alright, but that means we should ...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Shut everything down ... Is that something that...do you want us to shut everything down?

Speaker: limo driver
Dialogue: The other car is here sirs. Please allow me.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Yeah, sure. Look what happened to them.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: No, no, no, I told you. They're fine. They're all real happy.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: My next delivery is up that way, so I'll be getting down to it real soon.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: You're so easy.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Gotta keep an eye on her, that's all.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Yeah, what for?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Keep her from gettin' in trouble, that's all.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: What's  the matter now?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Nothing... I don't like being out in the open like this.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: It must be just so pathetic being you. Sure Billy, grab your dog we'll eat in the van.

Speaker: laney
Dialogue: Not here...no thanks.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Not a coke or anything?

Speaker: laney
Dialogue: No ... thanks though... I'll take a cigarette if you have one.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Sure, reach in my shirt pocket there.

Speaker: laney
Dialogue: No.  I haven't seen any.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: A brunette? ... maybe beat up?

Speaker: laney
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: You'll keep your eyes open for me won't you baby?

Speaker: laney
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: You bet you will.

Speaker: the man
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: the man
Dialogue: Same.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Well...  what do you think about then? I mean...  well what do you think about?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Well ... if you don't remember anything, I mean what goes through your mind then if you don't remember anything?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Nothing. I do remember the car crash... I told you... I remember the glass ... I think about that sometimes ... I remember walking here, sort of. Now I remember this place and you. That's about it.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: How do you remember how to talk?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: You don't remember anything else?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: No  There are things there.... but I'm... here.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: The money. You don't know where it came from?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Unh, unh.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: When you think about them... the money... the key ... does it make you remember anything?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: The money... I don't know about the money... the key... it makes me feel ... afraid.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Office...

Speaker: secretary
Dialogue: Adam Kesher's office.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: It's me. Where's Cynthia?

Speaker: secretary
Dialogue: She's on the set. I'll connect you Mr. Kesher.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Stage One.

Speaker: secretary
Dialogue: Paul, I have Mr. Kesher for Cynthia.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Right baby, all Hell's broke loose down here. I'll try to find her.

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: Adam, where are you?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: What's going on, Cynthia?

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: They've closed the set. They sent everybody home.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: What did you say?

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: They fired everyone.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Who fired everyone?

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: Ray did ... and then they closed the set.... everybody's gone. You'd better get down here Adam!

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: You've got to talk to Ray you've got to fix this.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: I'm going home.

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: Home! Meet me at the office. We've got to do something ... you've got to do something Adam!

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: I'm going home Cynthia.

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: Adam, this isn't like you. Please come to the office. There must be something we can do.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: I'm going home. I'll call you later.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I wonder where you were going.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Mulholland Drive.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Mulholland Drive?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: That's where I was going... Mulholland Drive.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Maybe that's where the accident was. There must be a police report. We could call.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: No.... I don't...

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: We could call anonymously from a pay phone... just to see if there was an accident.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Okay... but just...just to see.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Just to see if there was an accident on Mulholland Drive.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Come on... let's find you something to wear.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: It's terrible ... My Aunt dresses like Miss Marple.  She's kind of a frumpy woman detective in British movies.

Speaker: japanese gardener
Dialogue: Ah, Mister ... you remember me. I am Taka. your gardener. For long time I not see you. I pleased to see you.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Hello Taka. It's 'cause I'm never home in the day time. It's good to see you again. The garden looks great.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Lorraine ... you home?

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: Now, you've done it!

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Just forget you ever saw it. It's better that way.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: What the hell are you even doing here?

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: That bastard!

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: He's probably upset Lorraine.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: WHAT.. ARE ... YOU ... DOING!!!???

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: That's not a way to treat your wife, buddy. I don't care what she's done.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: Throw him out!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Hollywood Police Department please.

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Is this an emergency?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: No, no, I just want the number.

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Hold for the number.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Hollywood Police Department

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I'm inquiring about an accident that happened last night on Mulholland Drive.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Hold please. I'll connect you to traffic.

Speaker: sergeant baxter
Dialogue: Traffic. Sergeant Baxter speaking.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Hi. I'm inquiring ...well, I heard a sound last night that sounded like a car crash and I want to know if there was an accident on Mulholland Drive.

Speaker: sergeant baxter
Dialogue: Yes, there was.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Can you tell me what happened?

Speaker: sergeant baxter
Dialogue: No. I can't.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Was anyone hurt?

Speaker: sergeant baxter
Dialogue: May I have your name please?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: There was an accident. He wouldn't tell me anything else, but that was your accident Rita. I just know it was. Maybe there's something about it in the papers. Come on I'll buy you a cup of coffee and we can see.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: There's nothing?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Not that I can see.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: You're welcome. Will that be all? You want your check?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Just the coffee. Rita, you want something?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: No. Just the coffee.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: We'll take our check.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Shhhh.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Thank you. Come in again.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: You're welcome. We will.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: I remember something... I remember something!

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Diane Selwyn. Maybe it's my name.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Strange to be calling yourself.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Maybe it's not me.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Call the number.

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: Hi ... this is me. Leave me a message.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: It's not my voice ... but I know her.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Maybe the voice isn't Diane Selwyn. Maybe that's your roommate or if it is Diane Selwyn she can tell you who you are.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Maybe...maybe ... maybe.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Adam Kesher...he...

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: Yeah, right ... get lost!

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: This is Adam Kesher's house. Where...

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: Like hell it is! Get out ... NOW!!!

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I guess you don't understand English. She asked to leave. Here's the door.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: It's right about here on Sierra Bonita. That's not too far away.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: What's wrong with that?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: I'm not sure about this.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I know you're afraid of something. We'll be careful. Tomorrow we'll go over there and we'll find out.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: It'll be okay.

Speaker: louise
Dialogue: Where is Ruth?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Ruth's gone on a film. I'm her niece Betty.   Who are you?

Speaker: louise
Dialogue: Someone is in trouble. Who are you? Why are you in Ruth's apartment?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I'm her niece. She's letting me stay here. My name is Betty.

Speaker: louise
Dialogue: No it isn't. That's not it. That's not what she said. Something bad's happening. Where's Ruth?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but I don't know who you are and I'm...

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Louise... what're are you doing Louise?

Speaker: louise
Dialogue: Where have you been Coco? God, I've been trying to find you all afternoon since 3:00 o'clock. That one is in my room and she won't leave. I want you to get her out. I want you to get her out now.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: This is Louise Bonner. I'm sure she meant well.  Sorry about this. Sometimes it happens.

Speaker: louise
Dialogue: No, she said it was someone else in trouble.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Stop it, Louise. Let's get you home ... goodnight Betty.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Whoa!

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Yes...what is it?

Speaker: hotel manager
Dialogue: I'm sorry Mr. Kesher, but there seems to be some problem concerning your credit card.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: ... What??

Speaker: hotel manager
Dialogue: The fact is Mr. Kesher a representative of your bank called us.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: How...  how'd they know I was here?

Speaker: hotel manager
Dialogue: I don't know. All we do is take an impression of the credit card and until you check out it just sits in our files.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: So, what did they say?

Speaker: hotel manager
Dialogue: Well, Sir, I'm afraid they said you're overdrawn at your bank and your line of credit has been cancelled.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Unbelievable. Look... here.  I don't know what's going on. That's so much baloney. I've got enough cash for one night, okay?

Speaker: hotel manager
Dialogue: That's fine, Mr. Kesher. You can pay cash when you check out. I'm sorry. it was my duty to inform you.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Fine. I'll check out in the morning.

Speaker: hotel manager
Dialogue: Have a good evening, Mr. Kesher.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Someone's shut off my money!

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: I know.  Where are you Adam?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: What do you mean "you know"?

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: Someone called me. When they couldn't get you they told me you were as good as broke. I didn't believe then, so I made some calls.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: And?

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: You're broke!

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: But I'm not broke.

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: I know, but you're broke. Where are you?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Beverly Hills Hotel. I've got enough cash in my pocket for one night.

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: Do you know somebody called the The Cowboy?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: The Cowboy??

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: Yeah, the Cowboy. This guy, the Cowboy, wants to see you. Jason said he thought it would be a good idea.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Oh, Jason thought it would be a good idea for me to meet the Cowboy. Should I wear my ten gallon hat and my six shooters?

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: Something tells me this guy is connected with what's happening, Adam, and I think you should do it and I think you should do it right away.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Cynthia...what's going on?

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: It's been a very strange day.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: And getting stranger. Where do I meet this Cowboy? I mean do I have to ride out to the range?

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: Sort of, funny boy. If I tell him the meeting's on you're to go to the top of Beachwood Canyon. There's a corral up there where he'll be.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: You gotta be kidding?

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: Will you meet with him?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Yeah, sure. It is that kind of a day. When?

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: I'll call him, then call you back...If you want you could stay at my place.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Cynthia... that would not be a good idea.

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: I'm just offering a place to stay.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: I understand, Cynthia and thank you for the offer. I'll find a place. Now go ahead and give the Cowboy a yodel and get back to me.

Speaker: cynthia
Dialogue: Okay, but you don't know what you're missing.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Git along little dowgie and call me back.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: Howdy!

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Howdy to you.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: Beautiful night.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: Sure want to thank ya for drivin' all the way up to see me from that Beverly Hills Hotel.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: No problem. What's on your mind?

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: Well now, here's a man who wants to get right to it. Kinda anxious to get to it are ya?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Whatever.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: A man's attitude ... a man's attitude goes some ways toward how a man's life will be. Is that somethin' you agree with?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: Now... did you answer cause you thought that's what I wanted to hear or did you think about what I said and answer cause you truly believe that to be right?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: I agree with what you said...truly.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: What did I say?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: That a man's attitude determines to a large extent how his life will be.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: So since you agree I guess you could be a person who does not care about the good life.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: How's that?

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: Well, just stop for a little second and think about it. Will ya do that for me?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Okay, I'm thinking.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: No. You're too busy being a smart aleck to be thinkin'. Now I want ya to think and quit bein' such a smart aleck. Can ya do that for me?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Look ... where's this going? What do you want me to do?

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: There's sometimes a buggy. How many drivers does a buggy have?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: One.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: So let's just say I'm drivin' this buggy and you fix your attitude and you can ride along with me.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: Now I know a few things. I know you have had a rough day. You're probably thinkin' I don't know the half of it, but in actual fact I know every part of it. The business of gittin' thrown off your movie, the heartache of seeing your wife with another man... losin' access to that precious film vault...

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: It will work out.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: Good then, but, just in case, that bank's gonna stay closed a bit longer. You understand that?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: I understand.

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: You're an understandin' fella.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: So, this is the last time I see you then unless I do bad?

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: No, this one doesn't count. It's part of the original one. So then ... until we meet again.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: "You're still here?"

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: "I came back. I thought that's what you wanted."

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: "Nobody wants you here!"

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: "Really?"

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: "My parents are right upstairs! They think you've left..."

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: "So... surprise"...

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: "I can call them... I can call my dad... "

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: "But you won't..."

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: "You're playing a dangerous game here. If you're trying to blackmail me... it's not going to work."

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: "You know what I want...it's not that difficult."

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: "Get out! Get out before I call my dad ... he trusts you ... your his best friend. This will be the end of everything... "

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: "What about you? What will your dad think about you?"

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: "Stop! Just Stop! That's what you said from the beginning. If I tell what happened... they'll arrest you and put you in jail, so get out of here before..."

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: "Before what?"

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: "Before I kill you."

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: "Then they'd put you in jail."

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Cry, cry, cry, and then I say with big emotion, "I hate you... I hate us both!"

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: But you are really good.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Thank you dahling!

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Hello ... Ruthie... How's the great up north? ... Oh, I'm sorry to hear it ... what? Well, I haven't seen her if she's in there. Now, Ruthie there's nothing to worry about. I saw Betty last night and she was just fine. Yes, and I gave them to her. She's a real nice kid, Ruthie. Now stop worrying, will ya. I'll go over and have a look around. I will. I've got the production office number. I'll find you. Now keep your socks on up there and take lots of "C." Goodbye honey.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Oh, no wonder I'm starving. I'm going to fix a sandwich. You want one?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: I'm all right.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: You've got to eat something. You're just nervous about going over to see if you're Diane Selwyn.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Hi! Who are you?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Uh...Betty!?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Can I see you outside a minute Betty?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Your Aunt called me.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I was afraid of that.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: She wants to know who's staying in her apartment.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: It's just for a night or two, until she finds her own place. I tried to explain that to Aunt Ruth, but the connection was bad and her plane was leaving and she got it all mixed up. I kept telling her it was my friend and she kept saying she didn't know any Ritas ...

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Sweetie, look at me straight.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Coco...she's very nice. We went to school together.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: So I guess your Grandpa and Grandma know her.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Not really. I met her in junior college and she was from this other town.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Honey... I was married to a director for thirty years. He had an uncanny ability to read people. Maybe some of it rubbed off on me or maybe I had it all along ... you're a good kid... What you're telling me is a load of horse - pucky but it comes from a good place. I'll trust you to sort this out. Now I'm not going against Ruth. She's got enough to worry about up there in Canada. If she asks- I'm going to say everything is okay, and you make sure it is.  If you need any help you know where to find me.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: You're really something Coco...thank you.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Don't make me out to be a sucker. Louise Bonner says there's trouble in there. You remember last night. Sometimes she's wrong, but if there is trouble - get rid of it.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Is everything all right? Is it bad for you that I'm here?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Everything is A-okay, but I've gotta get that sandwich!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I hope I'm back in a couple of hours. Don't drink all the coke.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Good luck!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: When I get back I'll have the cab waiting, so be ready to go.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Sorry to trouble you, Coco.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: It's all right gorgeous. Something wrong?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: No, no. I'm on my way to my audition. Before I go I wanted to ask you if you could remember the man's name ... Aunt Ruthie's friend who helped put this together. It completely went out of my mind.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: His name's Wally Brown .... great guy. Been in the business since forever.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Thanks Coco. It'd be so embarrassing

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Naw! He wouldn't have cared. Just give him a good performance and he'll be happy and I've got a feeling you'll do just that.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Thanks Coco. I'll let you know.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Get going. You don't want to be late.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Right. See ya.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Good luck, honey!

Speaker: paramount guard
Dialogue: And where do we think we're going, Miss?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: To my audition.

Speaker: paramount guard
Dialogue: And who are we auditioning for today?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Wally Brown.

Speaker: paramount guard
Dialogue: And do we know which of the fifty-seven buildings Wally Brown is in?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: No, we don't.

Speaker: paramount guard
Dialogue: Well, now we've got to figure that out first don't we?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Yes, Sir.

Speaker: paramount guard
Dialogue: Mr.Wallace Brown is in the Executive Building on the second floor. We want to go in and turn right at the first street. Then we want to walk three blocks down past Stage 17 to the white Executive Building. Once we're on the second floor the receptionist will take us from there. Now do we have name?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Betty Elms.

Speaker: paramount guard
Dialogue: Let's see if we have a pass for Betty Elms ... and we do. Here we go. And good luck Miss. Elms.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Thank you... thank you very much.

Speaker: receptionist
Dialogue: Number 43, on the left.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: receptionist
Dialogue: May I help you?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: My name is Betty Elms. I'm here to audition for... Mr. Brown

Speaker: receptionist
Dialogue: Good. Perfect timing. Have a seat and I'll get Mr. Brown.

Speaker: wally
Dialogue: Betty Elms?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: wally
Dialogue: I'm Wally Brown. Your Aunt is a very dear friend of mine so it's particularly nice to meet you.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Very pleased to meet you.

Speaker: wally
Dialogue: Come in. I'd like you to meet everyone.

Speaker: sarah james
Dialogue: Why thank you, Wally. Hello Betty.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Pleased to meet you.

Speaker: sarah james
Dialogue: This is Nicki, my assistant.

Speaker: wally
Dialogue: And this is Martha, Martha Johnson, who you met out front.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: wally
Dialogue: Well. Shall we get to it? Would you like a water or a coffee before we begin?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: No, no, I'm fine.

Speaker: wally
Dialogue: Well then, take a seat everyone. Betty why don't you join Jimmy and we'll play the scene. Is there anything you'd like to say Bob... something to Betty before they begin?

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: No ... it's not a contest, see, the two of them with themselves, so don't play it for real until it gets real.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Just tell me where it hurts, baby.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: I want to play this one close, Bob. Like it was with that girl, what's her name, with the black hair. That felt good. Whaddya think?

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: That'd be good, Jimmy. Just don't rush that line again. I told you... the line where you say, "Before what?"

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: I was playin' off 'em. They say, "They'll arrest you"... and stuff like that.. "put you in jail"... they say it like that. They all say it the same way, so I react like that.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Betty.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Yeah ... Betty. You don't rush it. I don't rush it. We play it close, just like in the movies.

Speaker: wally
Dialogue: Bob?

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: And ... ACTION!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: You're still here?

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: I came back. I thought that's what you wanted.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Nobody wants you here.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: My parents are right upstairs! They think you've left.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: So ... surprise!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I can call them... I can call my dad.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: But you won't.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: You're playing a dangerous game here. if you're trying to blackmail me... it's not going to work.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: You know what I want...it's not that difficult.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: This will be the end of everything.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: What about you? What will your dad think about you?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Stop... just stop! That's what you said from the beginning. If I tell what happened... they'll arrest you and put you in jail, so get out of here before...

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Before what?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Before I kill you.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Then they'd put you in jail.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I hate you... I hate us both!

Speaker: sarah james
Dialogue: I'm going to take her over there.

Speaker: nicki
Dialogue: Big time!

Speaker: wally
Dialogue: Wow!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Well, there it was.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: There it was it was! Baby, you got a way!

Speaker: wally
Dialogue: Bob?

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Very good. Really. I mean it was forced maybe but still humanistic. Yeah, very good, really.

Speaker: wally
Dialogue: Well, thank you Betty, and I mean that. That was very impressive. You've done your Aunt proud and I'm going to tell her the first chance I get. We'll speak again soon I'm sure, and thank you so much for coming in.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Well, thank you.

Speaker: sarah james
Dialogue: Thank you, Wally. I'm sure you all have a lot to talk about. We'll walk Betty out.

Speaker: wally
Dialogue: Well, yes indeed. Our pleasure, Sarah, and don't you be a stranger. We'd love to see you around here again real soon.

Speaker: sarah james
Dialogue: Well come along, Betty.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Thank you again, Mr. Brown. It was nice meeting all of you.

Speaker: sarah james
Dialogue: Oh God, that was awful!

Speaker: nicki
Dialogue: How about that Jimmy Katz?

Speaker: sarah james
Dialogue: Oh god! Jimmy Katz never had a day. Jimmy Katz never had a minute. Poor Wally.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: They seem very nice to me, and Wally... Mr. Brown is a very close friend of my Aunt's, so. . .

Speaker: sarah james
Dialogue: Settle down, Betty. Don't get me wrong. I love Wally. I ought to. I was married to him for ten years.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Cut it!

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Oh, man, are you kidding? I love this script! Where do I sign?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Look... I love you, but there's no way they're gonna let me cast this thing until I've seen everyone. I'll let you know as soon as I can.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: I know you will ... cause my manager's gonna bug you day and night ... me too.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: It'll be my pleasure. Now, get out of here.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Oh, you're just so cruel... don't forget me. I'm the girl that's going to play this part.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: See ya later.

Speaker: hank
Dialogue: Camilla Rhodes.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Is she ready?

Speaker: hank
Dialogue: All ready.

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Bring her out.

Speaker: hank
Dialogue: Camilla Rhodes next!

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Playback!

Speaker: hank
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Get Jason over here.

Speaker: hank
Dialogue: Cindy ... Adam wants to see Jason.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Did you want to tell me something, Adam?

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: This is the girl!

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Excellent choice, Adam.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Oh ... oh...I have to be somewhere. I promised a friend.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: C'mom. There's nothing to be afraid of.

Speaker: cornell dumont
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Sol?

Speaker: cornell dumont
Dialogue: No ... not you...  I'm sorry... I forget your name.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Rita.

Speaker: cornell dumont
Dialogue: Yeah. Well, I haven't seen Sol lately. Tell him to come by the club.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: And what's your name?

Speaker: cornell dumont
Dialogue: Cornell Dumont.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Ask him who Sol is ...

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Why didn't you ask him? Sol knows you!

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: But I don't know, Sol. I never heard of Sol. I'd just get in trouble. That's why we shouldn't go see about Diane Selwyn... it's better not to get in trouble.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: You're not going to get in trouble. You're going to find out who you are. Finding out who you are gets you out of trouble.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: It should be around here...

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Don't stop!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: What is it? What do you see?!

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Those men in front, in the car.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Do you know them?!

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: No... but...

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Keep going. Go around to the back.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Oh no ... don't.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Diane?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Well ... we'll leave her a note.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I guess you're not Diane.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: I don't think...

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: C'mon help me in. I'll open the front door.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: PUSH!!!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Rita... I know what you're doing.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: What ... I..HAVE... to do.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: I know what you have to do, but let me do it.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: You look like someone else.

Speaker: wilkins
Dialogue: Hello. Adam. How's it going? No, it's okay. Yeah, I'm working, but... they wanted this script a week ago. What? What's wrong with your house? The poolman? Sure, you can have the couch. No, it's no problem..it's just I gotta ... I gotta work. Any chance you could bring some food. No, I got plenty of money - I just haven't gone out for awhile. Groovy man!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: You've been so good to me ... now we know why ... why I was so afraid. We know what kind of trouble I'm in. I shouldn't... ask you... I only have this to offer. I'll give you this if I can stay here for awhile. I don't know what else to do.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Rita... I want you to stay here and you don't have to give me that money.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: But I want to.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: No. We shouldn't touch that money. We don't know about that money. That might be dangerous money. You have to start all over again. You look like a brand new person and you can be a brand new person... whoever you want to be.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: It sounds kind of nice ... being somebody brand new.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Hey, let's introduce the brand new you to Hollywood. We haven't seen the roof garden yet.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Here I am Hollywood! My name's Betty.

Speaker: rita
Dialogue: Here I am Hollywood! My name is ... Rita.
